timeline.bodyText: What happened to StringUtils? Why can't we use it anymore?
timeline.author: meltsufin

replies.bodyText: org.apache.commons.lang3 was removed from dependencies and I don't want to bring it in only for this one method.
replies.author: dmitry-s

timeline.bodyText: Since you're appending each character at a time anyway in a StringBuilder, might as well just do String.split("/") and then do return arr[0] + "/" + arr[1] + ... + arr[3]; would be more readable (only 2-3 lines total).
timeline.author: dzou

replies.bodyText: You can even make it more efficient using the limit arg in String.split: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/lang/String.html#split(java.lang.String,%20int)
replies.author: dzou

replies.bodyText: I was trying to avoid unnecessary computation, since split allocates an array and then we need to combine the items. Also, split is a regex based method so the computational complexity is higher.
replies.author: dmitry-s
